dtliExcerpt: While Abigail Breslin brings star wattage and appealing naturalism to Helen Keller, it's Alison Pill who delivers the evening's powerhouse performance as Annie Sullivan.
bwwExcerpt: "Circle in the Square's last tenant, "The Norman Conquests," was a superlative example of the enhanced scrutiny and heightened involvement that can be afforded by in-the-round presentation. "The Miracle Worker" is a less ideal fit; its staging in this first Broadway revival appears shaped more by necessity than by concept. Kate Whoriskey directs William Gibson's midcentury chestnut with sensitivity, if not with any startling new insight. But the volatile battle of wills be
